item.title: Compiler Devlog #1 - Stack-based Intermediate Representation (IR)
item.description: Prologue So I started writing a compiler around a year ago, worked on it for about a month or two and then lost interest as with most of my side-projects… tsc tsc. Let’s be honest, there’s very little reason to write a compiler nowadays, if any. Hardware has gotten so powerful and software has gone so complex that we should all just use what’s already there. I feel like a Baby-Boomer born inside a Millenial body, because I miss the “good old days” (when I wasn’t even conceived yet).

item.title: Music
item.description: I’m a hobbyist musician since 2011, you can find a list of my music projects below: Urania: Post-rock band with only 1 single released :'). Corardor: Mostly vaporwave and avant-garde weird stuff. Slugcat: Math-Rock and Midwest Emo inspired project. gnemeth: Mostly dark ambient OSTs for my Quake maps.

item.title: Programming
item.description: I’ve been a professional programmer since 2014, I have worked with numerous web technologies, starting from PHP then moving to Python / NodeJS on the back-end, and Angular / ReactJS on the front-end. Today I work mainly as a systems programmer using C/C++, and as a mobile developer using Kotlin/Swift. You can find a list of my programming projects below: porter: Asynchronous HTTP client for C++(17) using libcurl. gattlib: A fork of gattlib (BLE communication library) with fixes and improvements.

item.title: Quake
item.description: I’m a hobbyist level designer for Quake, you can find a list of my maps and mods below: Celestine Cistern A map for the Blue Monday Jam, where the goal was to build a map with blue visuals. Download Humming Tunnels A map for the Speedmap Snack Pack, an episode built in under 24 hours. Download Terrainformation A map for the Speedmap session #210, “overgrown”-themed maps built under 48 hours.
